channel.title: Instrumentation and Measurement | Zhiqiang Huo Profile

item.title: üéì Appointed as Associate Editor of IEEE Transactions on Instrumentation and Measurement
item.description:
Appointed as Associate Editor of IEEE Transactions on Instrumentation and Measurement üìò

I am honored to share that I have been appointed as an Associate Editor (AE) of IEEE Transactions on Instrumentation and Measurement (IEEE TIM), following an invitation based on my recognized contributions to the journal as both an author and reviewer.

IEEE TIM is widely regarded as the leading journal in Instrumentation and Measurement, ranked No. 1 in General I&M by Impact Factor and positioned in Q1 of both the Instruments & Instrumentation and Electrical & Electronic Engineering categories of the Journal Citation Reports (JCR). Serving on its editorial board is both a privilege and a responsibility that I value greatly.

Editorial Role and Responsibilities ‚úçÔ∏è

As an Associate Editor, I will contribute to the peer-review and editorial decision-making process, supporting the journal‚Äôs mission to publish high-quality, rigorous, and impactful research across the full spectrum of instrumentation and measurement science.

In this role, I will contribute to the review of research on measurement and analysis in bioengineering and biomedical instrumentation, including wearable sensing, physiological signal acquisition, real-time and longitudinal measurements, and measurement-based decision support, with a focus on AI- and machine learning‚Äìdriven methods addressing real-world instrumentation challenges such as signal quality, reliability, robustness, and interpretability in healthcare settings.

item.title: üéñ Honored as an Outstanding Reviewer of 2024 by IEEE TIM
item.description:
Recognition as an Outstanding Reviewer of 2024

I am honored to be recognized as an Outstanding Reviewer of 2024 by the IEEE Transactions on Instrumentation and Measurement (TIM). This award highlights my contributions to rigorous and constructive peer review, ensuring the publication of high-quality research in instrumentation, measurement, and intelligent systems.

IEEE TIM is a leading journal covering advanced measurement techniques, sensor technology, and AI-driven industrial solutions. As a reviewer, I am committed to upholding academic integrity and helping researchers refine their work through insightful feedback.

Looking Forward üöÄ

I look forward to continuing my engagement with IEEE TIM and supporting the global research community by contributing to innovation in Digital Health Technology.
